senses.de: To make or become more varied or different
senses.ex: It's important to diversify your investment portfolio to spread risk.

Tips.title: Risk Management
Tips.description: Diversifying is crucial for reducing risk in various situations like investments or business strategies.
Tips.example: To weather market fluctuations, they diversified their holdings.

Tips.title: Beyond Finance
Tips.description: Though often used in finance, diversify can apply to many areas, such as diets, skill sets, or activities.
Tips.example: She diversified her skills by learning graphic design.

Tips.title: Stagnation Antonym
Tips.description: Use 'diversify' to imply change or variety as opposed to monotony or uniformity.
Tips.example: He diversified his daily routine to stay motivated.

senses.de: To change something in order to make it more diverse or varied
senses.ex: The company decided to diversify into new markets to increase revenue.

Tips.title: Market Expansion
Tips.description: In business, diversifying often involves entering new markets or expanding product lines to boost growth.
Tips.example: To tap into the teen market, the company diversified its product line.

Tips.title: Survival Strategy
Tips.description: Businesses diversify to adapt to changing markets and ensure long-term survival.
Tips.example: The tech firm diversified after the new regulations were announced.

senses.de: To make something full of different things or people
senses.ex: They are making efforts to diversify the community with people of different backgrounds.

Tips.title: Cultural Enrichment
Tips.description: Diversification can refer to the inclusion of diverse cultures to enrich communities or groups.
Tips.example: The festival diversified its music lineup to attract a wider audience.

Tips.title: Inclusivity Emphasis
Tips.description: The term often stresses efforts to be more inclusive, especially regarding minority groups.
Tips.example: The school's programs are diversified to include more underrepresented students.

Broad.wordDefinition:
Broad means something that covers a wide range or scope. For example, a broad range of colors means there are many different colors.

It can be applicable in many different situations, such as a broad selection of foods at a restaurant or a broad range of knowledge in a particular field.

Broad refers to the scope or range of something while diversify means to add variety or differences.

Broad can be applicable in many different situations, while diversify is often used in business contexts.

Enlarge.wordDefinition:
Enlarge means to make something bigger in size or amount. For example, a company might enlarge its factory in order to produce more goods.

While both words involve expansion or growth, diversify is used when referring to adding variety, while enlarge is used when talking about making something bigger in size or quantity.

Expand.wordDefinition:
Diversify means to add variety to something, while expand means to make something bigger or larger.

Expand is applicable when you want to increase the size or reach of something. For example, a business that is doing well and has many customers may decide to expand by opening new locations in different areas to reach more customers.

Diversify means to add variety while expand means to make bigger or larger.

Extend.wordDefinition:
Extend means to make something longer or stretch it out. For example, a person might extend their arm to reach something on a high shelf.

Extend can be used in a similar context, but often implies a continuation or expansion of something that already exists, rather than introducing something completely new.

Diversify is about adding variety or new things, while extend is about making something longer or expanding what already exists.

Increase.wordDefinition:
Diversify means to add variety or different things in a situation to spread the risk or increase options, while increase means to make something larger or more.

If you have a specific goal of making something bigger or more significant, you would use the word "increase." For instance, you would increase the number of hours you study every day to score better in your exams.

Diversify is used to add variety or different things to spread the risk or potential loss, while an increase is used to make something bigger or more significant.

Multiply.wordDefinition:
Multiply means to increase in quantity or number.

It can be applicable in a variety of contexts, such as math (multiplying numbers) or biology (cells multiplying).

Diversify adds variety while multiply increases quantity. Each is applicable in different contexts depending on the situation at hand.

Vary.wordDefinition:
Vary means to change something slightly or to have different instances of the same thing. For example, if someone wants to vary their workout routine, they might do different exercises or alternate between running and weightlifting.

Diversify is used when adding new elements to something to increase variety, while vary describes slight changes or different instances of the same thing.

Widen.wordDefinition:
Widen means to make something broader, larger, or more extensive. For example, widening a road means making it wider to accommodate more traffic.

Both words indicate a change or expansion, but diversify implies adding different elements, while widen implies expanding on what already exists.

Diversify is applicable when you want to add variety or reduce risk, while widen is applicable when you want to expand or accommodate more.

quotes.Text: Many financial advisors recommend that you diversify for your own protection. What they fail to tell you is that it is also for their protection. Since most financial advisors cannot tell you exactly which stock or mutual fund is a great investment, they tell you to buy a bunch of them.
quotes.Title: American Author
quotes.Name: Robert Kiyosaki

quotes.Text: We have decided to diversify agriculture; we decided to develop our tourism sector. We have decided to develop our mining sector. So these are some of the things we're telling Malawians: we say this is what we need to do in order for us to get out of this total dependence on aid.
quotes.Title: Politician
quotes.Name: Joyce Banda

quotes.Text: Nevada is a small state. I think we're doing well trying to diversify and grow and understanding that it takes time. We're going to have to continue to do that while continuing to support the thing that we're most famous for, being the entertainment capital of the world.
